title: F minor figured bass - cadential six-four, DC

content.question: Realize the figured bass below in four voices, following traditional eighteenth-century voice-leading procedures. Continue logically from the spacing of the first chord. Do not add embellishments unless indicated by the figured bass. In the space below each chord, supply the Roman numeral that appropriately indicates harmonic function. <!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}--> Enter any notes as you prepare your response.

frqParts.text: Realize the figured bass below in four voices, following traditional eighteenth-century voice-leading procedures. Continue logically from the spacing of the first chord. Do not add embellishments unless indicated by the figured bass. In the space below each chord, supply the Roman numeral that appropriately indicates harmonic function. <!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}--> Enter any notes as you prepare your response.

unit.text: 4: Harmony and Voice Leading I - Chord Function, Cadence, and Phrase

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Apply knowledge of common-practice tonality to spell chords and to follow procedures of 18th-century voice leading to connect chords in harmonic progressions.
